declarations.name: ArcgisGridControls
declarations.description:
The Grid Controls component provides a user interface (UI) for configuring and displaying a two-dimensional grid.
The grid displayed provides a network of horizontal and vertical lines used to divide the view into equal cells.
With support for snapping, the grid lines can be used as a reference when drawing features.
Note: grid controls are embedded in snapping controls for Sketch and Editor by default.

**Known limitations**

- Grid Controls is only supported in a 2D Map component.
- The grid spacing does not correspond to real world measurements. Distortion will be minimized when used in conjunction with an equal area basemap.
- The grid spacing input will be hidden when working with Web Mercator and Geographic Coordinate Systems.

members.name: autoDestroyDisabled
members.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-grid-controls/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

members.name: componentOnReady
members.description: Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.

docsTags.name: example

members.name: customColor
members.description: The custom color used for drawing the grid, if any.

members.name: destroy
members.description: Permanently destroy the component.

members.name: displayEnabled
members.description:
Returns `true` if the grid is enabled for display.
Use [trySetDisplayEnabled](#trySetDisplayEnabled) to enable or disable grid display.

members.name: dynamicScaling
members.description:
Returns `true` if the grid is set to scale dynamically. When dynamic scaling is enabled,
grid cells are added or removed to ensure that grid cells are a reasonable size on screen as the user zooms.
The way additional grid lines are shown is controlled by the [majorLineInterval](#majorLineInterval) property.

members.name: effectiveSpacingAfterDynamicScaling
members.description: Returns the actual spacing of grid lines after dynamic scaling has been applied at the current scale.

members.name: gridColor
members.description: Controls the color of the major grid lines. Minor grid lines are a slightly transparent version of this color.

members.name: gridControlsEnabled
members.description: Returns `true` if the grid is in a valid state for manually setting grid properties or starting an interactive placement.

members.name: gridOutOfScale
members.description:
True if the grid is currently not displayed (and therefore also not a valid snap target),
because [dynamicScaling](#dynamicScaling) is off and the grid cells are too small
to render at the current scale.

members.name: hideColorSelection
members.description: Controls display of the color and theme selection options.

members.name: hideDynamicScaleToggle
members.description:
Controls display of the dynamic scaling toggle. Dynamic scaling adjusts the size of the grid to work
well regardless of view scale.

members.name: hideGridEnabledToggle
members.description: Controls display of the grid enabled toggle. This toggle controls whether the grid is displayed.

members.name: hideGridSnapEnabledToggle
members.description: Controls display of the grid snapping enabled toggle. This toggle controls whether snapping is enabled.

members.name: hideLineIntervalInput
members.description: Controls display of the line interval input field for setting the interval between major grid lines.

members.name: hideNumericInputs
members.description: Controls display of the numeric input fields for setting grid spacing and rotation.

members.name: hideOutOfScaleWarning
members.description:
Controls display of the out of scale warning. This warning is displayed when the grid is not shown
because it would be too small at the current scale and dynamic scaling is disabled.

members.name: hidePlacementButtons
members.description:
Controls display of the grid placement buttons. These buttons allow the user to start interactive
configuration of the grid.

members.name: hideRotateWithMapToggle
members.description: Controls display of the rotate with map toggle. This toggle controls whether the grid rotates with the map.

members.name: icon
members.description:
Icon which represents the component.
Typically used when the component is controlled by another component (e.g. by the Expand component).

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [Calcite Icons](https://developers.arcgis.com/calcite-design-system/icons/)

members.name: interactivePlacementState
members.description:
Sets the interactive placement state, either starting or ending a draw operation that implicitly adjusts the grid.
Interactive placement allows the user to define the center of the grid, then the scale and rotation of the grid by
drawing a second point. Setting this to "place" allows the user to move the grid center only. Setting this to "rotate"
keeps the scale and center of the grid constant while rotating the grid by defining a second point.

members.name: label
members.description: The component's default label.

members.name: majorLineInterval
members.description:
Controls the number of grid cells shown between major grid lines. Can be anything between 1 and 15.
No minor grid lines are shown when this is set to 1.

members.name: messageOverrides
members.description:
Replace localized message strings with your own strings.

_**Note**: Individual message keys may change between releases._

members.name: placementDisabled
members.description:
Use this property to disable the interactive grid placement buttons as needed.
An example use case might be to block interaction while another interactive operation
(e.g. sketching) is in progress.

members.name: referenceElement
members.description: By assigning the `id` attribute of the Map or Scene component to this property, you can position a child component anywhere in the DOM while still maintaining a connection to the Map or Scene.

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [Associate components with a Map or Scene component](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/programming-patterns/#associate-components-with-a-map-or-scene-component)

members.name: rotateWithMap
members.description: Controls whether the grid rotates with the map, or stays fixed to the screen.

members.name: rotation
members.description: Rotation of the grid in radians. NOTE: UI controls convert to and from degrees automatically.

members.name: snappingEnabled
members.description:
Controls snapping behavior if [snappingOptions](#snappingOptions) has been defined.
If [snappingOptions](#snappingOptions) have been defined, disabling or enabling grid snapping will
also disable or enable grid display.

members.name: snappingOptions
members.description:
The [SnappingOptions](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-interactive-snapping-SnappingOptions.html)
that will be controlled by this component if the snapping toggle is enabled for display.
If SnappingOptions are provided, grid display will be automatically enabled or disabled to match snapping state.

members.name: spacing
members.description: Length of a grid cell. Grid cells are always square. Defined in [unit](#unit).

members.name: theme
members.description:
The color scheme used to display the grid. This will be light, dark, or custom. When theme is set to custom,
the [customColor](#customColor) is shown, otherwise a default light or dark theme color is used.

members.name: trySetDisplayEnabled
members.description: Call this to turn the grid on/off.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: enabled Desired end state for grid display.

members.name: unit
members.description:
Unit of measure (foot, meter, etc) used when defining the [spacing](#spacing) grid cell.
Note that units are defined relatively to the map's spatial reference length unit,
which will not correspond to geographic distance unless using a special-purpose basemap
within a supported target area.

When using Web Mercator, the projection defines the length of a meter in projection system units;
this length is equal to a geographic meter only at the equator. On screen, the size of the grid cells is constant
from the equator to the poles, but the real-world size of the grid cell is much larger further from the equator.

The length of the grid cells can usefully correspond to a geographic length when the Grid is used with an
appropriate spatial reference (for example a local system or a State Plane system) within the reference's area of interest.

members.name: view
members.description:
The view associated with the component. 
  > **Note:** The recommended approach is to fully migrate applications to use map and scene components and avoid using MapView and SceneView directly. However, if you are migrating a large application from widgets to components, you might prefer a more gradual transition. To support this use case, the SDK includes this `view` property which connects a component to a MapView or SceneView. Ultimately, once migration is complete, the Grid Controls component will be associated with a map or scene component rather than using the `view` property.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-grid-controls/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

attributes.name: custom-color
attributes.description: The custom color used for drawing the grid, if any.

attributes.name: dynamic-scaling
attributes.description:
Returns `true` if the grid is set to scale dynamically. When dynamic scaling is enabled,
grid cells are added or removed to ensure that grid cells are a reasonable size on screen as the user zooms.
The way additional grid lines are shown is controlled by the [majorLineInterval](#majorLineInterval) property.

attributes.name: effective-spacing-after-dynamic-scaling
attributes.description: Returns the actual spacing of grid lines after dynamic scaling has been applied at the current scale.

attributes.name: grid-color
attributes.description: Controls the color of the major grid lines. Minor grid lines are a slightly transparent version of this color.

attributes.name: grid-out-of-scale
attributes.description:
True if the grid is currently not displayed (and therefore also not a valid snap target),
because [dynamicScaling](#dynamicScaling) is off and the grid cells are too small
to render at the current scale.

attributes.name: hide-color-selection
attributes.description: Controls display of the color and theme selection options.

attributes.name: hide-dynamic-scale-toggle
attributes.description:
Controls display of the dynamic scaling toggle. Dynamic scaling adjusts the size of the grid to work
well regardless of view scale.

attributes.name: hide-grid-enabled-toggle
attributes.description: Controls display of the grid enabled toggle. This toggle controls whether the grid is displayed.

attributes.name: hide-grid-snap-enabled-toggle
attributes.description: Controls display of the grid snapping enabled toggle. This toggle controls whether snapping is enabled.

attributes.name: hide-line-interval-input
attributes.description: Controls display of the line interval input field for setting the interval between major grid lines.

attributes.name: hide-numeric-inputs
attributes.description: Controls display of the numeric input fields for setting grid spacing and rotation.

attributes.name: hide-out-of-scale-warning
attributes.description:
Controls display of the out of scale warning. This warning is displayed when the grid is not shown
because it would be too small at the current scale and dynamic scaling is disabled.

attributes.name: hide-placement-buttons
attributes.description:
Controls display of the grid placement buttons. These buttons allow the user to start interactive
configuration of the grid.

attributes.name: hide-rotate-with-map-toggle
attributes.description: Controls display of the rotate with map toggle. This toggle controls whether the grid rotates with the map.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
Icon which represents the component.
Typically used when the component is controlled by another component (e.g. by the Expand component).

attributes.name: interactive-placement-state
attributes.description:
Sets the interactive placement state, either starting or ending a draw operation that implicitly adjusts the grid.
Interactive placement allows the user to define the center of the grid, then the scale and rotation of the grid by
drawing a second point. Setting this to "place" allows the user to move the grid center only. Setting this to "rotate"
keeps the scale and center of the grid constant while rotating the grid by defining a second point.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The component's default label.

attributes.name: major-line-interval
attributes.description:
Controls the number of grid cells shown between major grid lines. Can be anything between 1 and 15.
No minor grid lines are shown when this is set to 1.

attributes.name: placement-disabled
attributes.description:
Use this property to disable the interactive grid placement buttons as needed.
An example use case might be to block interaction while another interactive operation
(e.g. sketching) is in progress.

attributes.name: reference-element
attributes.description: By assigning the `id` attribute of the Map or Scene component to this property, you can position a child component anywhere in the DOM while still maintaining a connection to the Map or Scene.

attributes.name: rotate-with-map
attributes.description: Controls whether the grid rotates with the map, or stays fixed to the screen.

The initial value is determined in a few different ways:

If no referenceElement is provided, the value is `null`.
Once the referenceElement is ready, the initial viewpoint value is the user-defined [Viewpoint](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Viewpoint.html).

declarations.name: ArcgisLegend
declarations.description:
The Legend component displays the symbols and labels used to represent layers in a [arcgis-map](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-map/) or [arcgis-scene](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/).
Only layers and sublayers visible in the view are shown, unless [ignoreLayerVisibility](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-legend/#ignoreLayerVisibility) is set to `true`.

The legend automatically updates when:
 - the visibility of a layer or sublayer changes
 - a layer is added or removed from the map
 - a layer's `renderer`, `opacity`, or `title` is changed
 - the `legendEnabled` property is changed (set to `true` or `false` on the layer)

## Known Limitations

* Currently, the legend component does not support the following layer types:
[ElevationLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-ElevationLayer.html),
[GraphicsLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-GraphicsLayer.html),
[IntegratedMeshLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-IntegratedMeshLayer.html),
[KMLLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-KMLLayer.html),
[MapNotesLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-MapNotesLayer.html),
[OpenStreetMapLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-OpenStreetMapLayer.html),
[VectorTileLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-VectorTileLayer.html),
[VideoLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-VideoLayer.html), and
[WebTileLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-WebTileLayer.html).
* [Symbol3D](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-Symbol3D.html) with more than one
[symbol](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-Symbol3DLayer.html) are not supported.
* [DictionaryRenderer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-renderers-DictionaryRenderer.html) is not supported.
* [TrackInfo](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-support-TrackInfo.html) is not supported.
* CIM Symbol [primitiveOverride](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-CIMSymbol.html#PrimitiveOverride) is not supported.
* RasterStretchRenderer [dynamicRangeAdjustment](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-renderers-RasterStretchRenderer.html#dynamicRangeAdjustment) is not supported.

## Various examples of legends based on renderer type.

### Unique values

[![Unique values](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/legend/legend-unique-values.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/visualization-location-types/)

### Continuous color

[![Continuous color](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/legend/legend-color-vv.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/visualization-vv-color/)

### Classed color

[![Classed color](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/legend/legend-class-breaks.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/visualization-classbreaks/)

### Continuous size

[![Continuous size](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/legend/legend-size.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/visualization-sm-size/)

### Size - above and below

[![Size - above and below](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/legend/legend-size-themes.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/visualization-sm-size-themes/)

### Dot density

[![Dot density](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/legend/legend-dot-density.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/visualization-dot-density/)

### Predominance

[![Predominance](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/legend/legend-predominance.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/visualization-arcade/)

### Relationship

[![Relationship](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/legend/legend-relationship.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/visualization-sm-relationship/)


## Legend labels

Legend text is directly controlled through the [layer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-Layer.html) and [renderer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-renderers-Renderer.html) properties. For example, `layer.title` is directly used by the legend to present a layer's symbology to the end user. To override this text, you can directly update `layer.title`.

Furthermore, you can control date and number formatting in Legend by using the [FieldConfiguration](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-support-FieldConfiguration.html) formatting options on the layer. As an alternative to this, you can override Legend text via the renderer's properties. For example, the renderer may have a [legendOptions](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-renderers-ClassBreaksRenderer.html#legendOptions) property (or a label property in the case of visual variable stops or UniqueValueInfos) that can be used to override default legend text describing the renderer element in question. The [Update legend text sample](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/legend-update/) provides an example of overriding legend text via the renderer.

Note that when you override legend text, all formatting and localization that would otherwise be dynamically applied to labels will no longer apply.

members.description:
Collection of [ActiveLayerInfo](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-widgets-Legend-support-ActiveLayerInfo.html) objects used by the legend view to
display data in the legend. The legend component watches this property to hide or display the layer's legend when
an [ActiveLayerInfo](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-widgets-Legend-support-ActiveLayerInfo.html) is removed from or added to this collection.

members.name: autoDestroyDisabled
members.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-legend/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

members.name: basemapLegendVisible
members.description:
Indicates whether to show the [Basemap](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Basemap.html) layers in the Legend. If you set this property to
`true` and specify [layerInfos](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-legend/#layerInfos) that include the basemap layers, the basemap will be displayed in the legend.

docsTags.name: example

members.name: cardStyleLayout
members.description:
Indicates the layout of the legend when the [legendStyle](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-legend/#legendStyle) is set to the string value of `"card"`.
The layout determines how the legend's content is arranged.

[![card-style-layout](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/components/legend/card-style-layout.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/legend-card/)

docsTags.name: example

members.description: Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.

docsTags.name: example

members.name: destroy
members.description: Permanently destroy the component.

members.name: headingLevel
members.description:
Indicates the heading level to use for the legend title. By default, legend titles are rendered as level 3 headings (e.g. `

Legend title

`). Depending on the legend placement in your app, you may need to adjust this heading for proper semantics. This is important for meeting accessibility standards.

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [Heading Elements](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Heading_Elements)

docsTags.name: example
docsTags.text:
Legend title will render as an `<h2>`

```html
<arcgis-legend heading-level="2"></arcgis-legend>
```

```js
document.querySelector("arcgis-legend").headingLevel = 2;
```

members.name: hideLayersNotInCurrentView
members.description:
When `true`, layers will only be shown in the legend if they are visible in the view's extent. When data from a layer
is not visible in the view, the layer's legend information will be hidden. Only layers that implement the `createQuery()`
and `queryFeatureCount()` methods are supported by `hideLayersNotInCurrentView`.

To hide layers completely from the legend, you should set the `legendEnabled` property of the layer to `false`.

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [ignoreLayerVisibility](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-legend/#ignoreLayerVisibility)

docsTags.name: example
docsTags.text:
Layers not displayed in the current map extent will not be shown in the legend

```html
<arcgis-legend hide-layers-not-in-current-view></arcgis-legend>
```

```js
document.querySelector("arcgis-legend").hideLayersNotInCurrentView = true;
```

members.name: icon
members.description:
Icon which represents the component.
Typically used when the component is controlled by another component (e.g. by the Expand component).

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [Calcite Icons](https://developers.arcgis.com/calcite-design-system/icons/)

members.name: ignoreLayerVisibility
members.description:
Determines whether to respect the properties of the layers in the map that control the legend's visibility (`minScale`, `maxScale`, `legendEnabled`).
By default, a layer's legend elements **will not render** in the legend given the following conditions:

- The layer's [legendEnabled](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-FeatureLayer.html#legendEnabled) property
is set to `false`.
- If the view's scale is outside the visibility range
defined by the layer's [minScale](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-FeatureLayer.html#minScale) and
[maxScale](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-FeatureLayer.html#maxScale) properties.

When the `ignoreLayerVisibility` property of the legend is set to `true`, the legend elements for each
layer in the map will always display, thus disregarding the `minScale`, `maxScale`,
and `legendEnabled` properties for each layer in the map.

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [hideLayersNotInCurrentView](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-legend/#hideLayersNotInCurrentView)

docsTags.name: example
docsTags.text:
Always displays legend elements for the map's layers regardless of their minScale, maxScale, and legendEnabled properties.

```html
<arcgis-legend ignore-layer-visibility></arcgis-legend>
```

```js
document.querySelector("arcgis-legend").ignoreLayerVisibility = true;
```

members.description: The component's default label.

members.name: layerInfos

Specifies a subset of the layers to display in the legend. This includes any basemap layers

basemap layers if [basemapLegendVisible](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-legend/#basemapLegendVisible) is `true`. Objects in this array are defined with the properties in the example below.

members.name: view
members.description:
The view associated with the component. 
  > **Note:** The recommended approach is to fully migrate applications to use map and scene components and avoid using MapView and SceneView directly. However, if you are migrating a large application from widgets to components, you might prefer a more gradual transition. To support this use case, the SDK includes this `view` property which connects a component to a MapView or SceneView. Ultimately, once migration is complete, the Legend component will be associated with a map or scene component rather than using the `view` property.

declarations.name: ArcgisLineOfSight
declarations.description:
The Line Of Sight component is a 3D analysis tool that allows you to perform
[line of sight visibility analysis](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-analysis-LineOfSightAnalysis.html)
in a [Scene](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/). Visibility between a given observer and multiple target points is calculated against the currently
displayed content in the view, including the ground, integrated meshes, and 3D objects such as buildings or trees.

![line-of-sight](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/line-of-sight.png)

The analysis results are displayed as colored lines, where areas visible to the observer are
shown green and occluded parts are marked in red. Also, the color of the target points indicates their visibility.
When the line of sight cannot be calculated, it will be displayed with a gray color. This may happen if either
the target or the observer is not in the view.

When creating a new line of sight analysis, the first click in the Scene creates the
[observer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-analysis-LineOfSightAnalysisObserver.html)
and subsequent clicks place the [targets](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-analysis-LineOfSightAnalysisTarget.html).
Both the observer and target points can be moved by dragging. Additionally, the target points can be removed with a right click.

**Known limitation**

Line Of Sight is only supported in a 3D [Scene](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/) component.

**See also**

- [LineOfSightAnalysis](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-analysis-LineOfSightAnalysis.html)
- [Sample - Line of sight component](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/line-of-sight/)
- [Sample - Analysis objects](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/analysis-objects/)

component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-line-of-sight/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

members.name: clear
members.description: Clear the current analysis results. After calling this method, the user can set a new observer and targets.

members.name: label

members.name: messageOverrides

Replace localized message strings with your own strings.

_**Note**: Individual message keys may change between releases._

members.name: referenceElement
members.description: By assigning the `id` attribute of the Map or Scene component to this property, you can position a child component anywhere in the DOM while still maintaining a connection to the Map or Scene.

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [Associate components with a Map or Scene component](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/programming-patterns/#associate-components-with-a-map-or-scene-component)

members.name: start
members.description: Start a new line of sight analysis.

members.name: state
members.description:
The component's state. The values mean the following:

* `disabled` -  not ready yet
* `ready` - ready for analysis
* `creating` - observer/target points are being placed
* `created` - finished analysis

members.name: stop
members.description:
Stop the current placing of line of sight analysis. Any lines added this far are kept  in the view.
Users can still interact with existing targets and the observer, but they cannot place new target points.

members.name: view
members.description:
The view associated with the component. 
  > **Note:** The recommended approach is to fully migrate applications to use map and scene components and avoid using MapView and SceneView directly. However, if you are migrating a large application from widgets to components, you might prefer a more gradual transition. To support this use case, the SDK includes this `view` property which connects a component to a MapView or SceneView. Ultimately, once migration is complete, the Line Of Sight component will be associated with a map or scene component rather than using the `view` property.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-line-of-sight/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
Icon which represents the component.
Typically used when the component is controlled by another component (e.g. by the Expand component).

attributes.description: The component's default label.

The component's state. The values mean the following:

* `disabled` -  not ready yet
* `ready` - ready for analysis
* `creating` - observer/target points are being placed
* `created` - finished analysis

events.name: arcgisPropertyChange
events.description: Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.

events.name: arcgisReady
events.description: Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is ready to be interacted with.

declarations.name: ArcgisLinkChart
declarations.description:
Loads a [WebLinkChart](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-WebLinkChart.html) from an [ArcGIS Enterprise portal](https://enterprise.arcgis.com/en/portal/latest/administer/windows/what-is-portal-for-arcgis-.htm) into a [LinkChartView](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-LinkChartView.html).

Note: Sign in to access the data in this demo, U/P: `viewer01`/`I68VGU^nMurF`

members.name: addLayer
members.deprecated:
since 4.33, use `element.map.add(layer)` instead.

Adds a layer to the map layers collection.

members.name: addLayers
members.deprecated:
since 4.33, use `element.map.addMany([layer])` instead.

Adds a layer or array of layers to the map layers collection.

members.name: allLayerViews
members.description:
Collection containing a flat list of all the created LayerViews
related to the basemap, operational layers, and group layers in this view.

members.name: analyses
members.description:
A collection of analyses associated with the view.

[Read more...](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-View2D.html#analyses)

members.name: animationsDisabled
members.description:
Indicates whether animations are disabled in the view. This includes animated symbols (animated
[CIMSymbol](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-CIMSymbol.html),
[PictureMarkerSymbol](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-PictureMarkerSymbol.html)
from a GIF/animated PNG), animated renderers
([FlowRenderer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-rasterRenderers.html#FlowRenderer)),
animated layers ([MediaLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-MediaLayer.html),
[VideoLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-VideoLayer.html)), and
animations triggered by view navigation (for example,
[goTo()](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-LinkChartView.html#goTo)).
Setting this property to `true` disables all animations in the view.

members.name: aria
members.description: The ARIA attributes for the view container. Provides accessibility information to assistive technologies such as screen readers. Supports the following properties: [`label`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Reference/Attributes/aria-label), [`description`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Reference/Attributes/aria-description), [`describedByElements`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/ariaDescribedByElements), and [`labelledByElements`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/ariaLabelledByElements).

members.name: autoDestroyDisabled
members.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-link-chart/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

members.name: background
members.description:
The background color of the LinkChartView. If the view's link chart changes, the view's `background` is reset to the link chart's background,
even if the user set it previously.

members.name: basemap
members.description:
Specifies a basemap for the link chart. The basemap is only visible when the link
chart is set to a geographic layout. See
[documentation on layouts](https://enterprise.arcgis.com/en/knowledge/latest/knowledge-studio/change-the-layout-applied-to-a-link-chart.htm)
for more detail. The basemap is a set of layers that give
geographic context to the LinkChartView and the other operational layers
in the link chart.

members.name: basemapView
members.description: Represents the view for a single basemap after it has been added to the link chart.

members.name: center
members.description:
Represents the view's center point; when setting the center, you may pass a
esri/geometry/Point instance or a string representing
a longitude/latitude pair (`"-100.4593, 36.9014"`).
Setting the center immediately changes the current view.
For animating the view, see this component's goTo() method.

members.name: closePopup
members.description: Closes the popup.

members.name: componentOnReady
members.description: Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.

docsTags.name: example

members.name: constraints
members.description: Specifies constraints to scale, zoom, and rotation that may be applied to the LinkChartView.

members.name: destroy
members.description: Destroys the view, and any associated resources, including its map, popup, and UI elements.

members.name: displayFilterDisabled
members.description:
Indicates whether layer's displayFilter are honored when rendering layers in the view.
If `false`, display filters are ignored and all features are rendered.

members.name: extent
members.description:
The extent represents the visible portion of a link chart within the view as an instance of
[Extent](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-geometry-Extent.html).
Setting the extent immediately changes the view without animation. To animate
the view, see this component's goTo() method.
When the view is rotated, the extent does not update to include the newly visible portions of the link chart.

members.name: fatalError
members.description: A rejected view indicates a fatal error making it unable to display.

members.name: goTo
members.description: Sets the view to a given target.

members.name: graphics
members.description: Allows for adding graphics directly to the default graphics in the View.

docsTags.name: example
example

members.name: highlightOptions
members.description: Options for configuring the highlight.
members.deprecated: since version 4.32. Use the [highlights](#highlights) property instead.

members.name: highlights
members.description:
The highlights property is a collection of HighlightGroup objects that
allow you to visually emphasize specific features on the link chart.

members.name: interacting
members.description: Indication whether the view is being interacted with (for example when panning or by an interactive tool).

members.name: itemId
members.description:
The ID of a WebLinkChart from an ArcGIS Enterprise portal.

To configure the portal url you must set the [`portalUrl` property on `config`](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-config.html#portalUrl) before the Link Chart component loads.

members.name: layerViews
members.description:
A collection containing a hierarchical list of all the created
[LayerViews](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-layers-LayerView.html) of the
[operational layers](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-WebLinkChart.html#layers) in the link chart.

members.name: loadErrorSources
members.description: An array of objects that encountered an error while loading the component or any of its dependencies (e.g., basemap, ground, layers, tables). You may inspect the errors by accessing each object's `loadError` property.

type.text: Array<WebLinkChart | Basemap | Ground | Layer | WebMap | WebScene>

members.name: magnifier
members.description: The magnifier allows for showing a portion of the view as a magnifier image on top of the view.

members.name: map
members.description:
An instance of a [WebLinkChart](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-WebLinkChart.html)
object to display in the view.

members.name: navigating
members.description: Indication whether the view is being navigated (for example when panning).

members.name: navigation
members.description: Options to configure the navigation behavior of the View.

members.name: openPopup
members.description:
Opens the popup at the given location with content defined either explicitly with content or driven
from the PopupTemplate of input features.

members.name: padding
members.description:
Use the padding property to make the [center](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#center),
and [extent](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#extent), etc.

members.name: popup
members.description:
A [Popup](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-widgets-Popup.html) object that displays general content or attributes from
[layers](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html#layers) in the [map](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-View2D.html#map).

[Read more...](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-View2D.html#popup)

members.name: popupDisabled
members.description: Controls whether the popup opens automatically when users click on the view.

members.name: ready
members.description:
When `true`, this property indicates whether the view successfully satisfied all dependencies,
signaling that the following conditions are met.

members.name: resizeAlign
members.description:
Defines which anchor stays still while resizing the browser window. The default, `center`,
ensures the view's center point remains constantly visible as the window size changes. The other
options allow  the respective portion of the view to remain visible when the window's size is changed.

members.name: resolution
members.description:
Represents the current value of one pixel in the unit of the view's spatialReference.
The value of resolution is calculated by dividing the view's extent width
by its width.

members.name: rotation
members.description:
The clockwise rotation of due north in relation to the top of the view in degrees.
The view may be rotated by directly setting
the rotation or by using the following mouse event: `Right-click + Drag`.
WebLinkChart rotation may be disabled by setting the `rotationEnabled` property
in [constraints](#constraints) to `false`.

members.name: scale
members.description:
Represents the link chart scale at the center of the view. Setting the scale immediately changes the view. For animating
the view, see this component's goTo() method.

members.name: spatialReference
members.description:
The spatial reference of the view.
This indicates the projected or geographic coordinate system used
to locate geographic features in the link chart.

members.name: stationary
members.description: Indication whether the view is animating, being navigated with or resizing.

members.name: suspended
members.description: Indicates if the view is visible on the page.

members.name: theme
members.description:
This property specifies the base colors used by some widgets
and components to render graphics and labels.

members.name: timeExtent
members.description:
The view's time extent. Time-aware layers display their temporal data that falls within
the view's time extent. Setting the view's time extent is similar to setting the spatial
extent because once the time extent is set, the
view updates automatically to conform to the change.

members.name: timeZone
members.description:
Defines the time zone of the view.
The time zone property determines how dates and times are represented to the user,
but the underlying data is unchanged.

members.name: tryFatalErrorRecovery
members.description: Call this method to clear any fatal errors resulting from a lost WebGL context.

members.name: updating
members.description:
Indicates whether the view is being updated by additional data requests to the network,
or by processing received data.

members.name: view
members.description: Internal view of the component.

members.name: viewOnReady
members.description:
`viewOnReady()` may be leveraged once an instance of the component and its underlying [view](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-link-chart/#view) is created and ready.
This method takes two input parameters, a `callback` function and an `errback` function, and returns a promise. The `callback` executes when the promise resolves, and the `errback` executes if the promise is rejected.

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [Watch for changes - waiting for components or views to be ready](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/watch-for-changes/#waiting-for-components-or-views-to-be-ready)

docsTags.name: example

members.name: viewpoint
members.description:
Represents the current view as a Viewpoint or point of observation on the view.
Setting the viewpoint immediately changes the current view. For animating
the view, see this component's goTo() method.

members.name: whenAnalysisView
members.description:
Gets the analysis view created for the given analysis object.

[Read more](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#whenAnalysisView)

members.name: whenLayerView
members.description: Gets the LayerView created on the view for the given layer.

members.name: zoom
members.description:
Represents the level of detail (LOD) at the center of the view.
A zoom level (or scale) is a number that defines how large or small the contents of a link chart appear in a link chart view.
Zoom level is a number usually between 0 (global view) and 23 (very detailed view) and is used as a shorthand for predetermined scale values.
A value of -1 means the view has no LODs.
When setting the zoom value, the LinkChartView converts it to the corresponding scale, or interpolates it if the zoom is a fractional number.
LinkChartView can display link charts with different projections at a full range of scales, and so use the scale property on this component rather than zoom level.

Setting the zoom immediately changes the current view. For animating the view, see this component's goTo() method.
Setting this property in conjunction with `center` is a convenient way to set the initial extent of the view.

attributes.name: animations-disabled
attributes.description:
Indicates whether animations are disabled in the view. This includes animated symbols (animated
[CIMSymbol](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-CIMSymbol.html),
[PictureMarkerSymbol](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-PictureMarkerSymbol.html)
from a GIF/animated PNG), animated renderers
([FlowRenderer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-rasterRenderers.html#FlowRenderer)),
animated layers ([MediaLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-MediaLayer.html),
[VideoLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-VideoLayer.html)), and
animations triggered by view navigation (for example,
[goTo()](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-LinkChartView.html#goTo)).
Setting this property to `true` disables all animations in the view.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled

disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-link-chart/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

events.name: arcgisLoadError
events.description: Fires when a ArcgisLinkChart fails to load or if one of its dependencies fails to load (e.g., basemap, ground, layers).

events.name: arcgisViewAnalysisViewCreate
events.description:
Fires when the view for an analysis is created.

[Read more](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#event-analysis-view-create)

events.name: arcgisViewAnalysisViewCreateError
events.description:
Fires when an error occurs during the creation of an analysis view after an analysis is added to the view.

[Read more](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#event-analysis-view-create-error)

events.name: arcgisViewAnalysisViewDestroy
events.description:
Fires after an analysis view is destroyed.

[Read more](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#event-analysis-view-destroy)

events.name: arcgisViewChange
events.description:
This event is for view related property changes: zoom, scale, center, rotation, extent, camera, viewpoint.
This event will also emit if stationary toggles from true to false.

events.name: arcgisViewClick
events.description: Fires after a user clicks on the view.

events.name: arcgisViewDoubleClick
events.description: Fires after double-clicking on the view.

events.name: arcgisViewDrag
events.description: Fires during a pointer drag on the view.

events.name: arcgisViewHold
events.description: Fires during a pointer drag on the view.

events.name: arcgisViewImmediateClick
events.description: Fires right after a user clicks on the view.

events.name: arcgisViewImmediateDoubleClick
events.description: Is emitted after two consecutive immediate-click events.

events.name: arcgisViewKeyDown
events.description: Fires after a keyboard key is pressed.

events.name: arcgisViewKeyUp
events.description: Fires after a keyboard key is pressed.

events.name: arcgisViewLayerviewCreate
events.description: Fires after each layer in the link chart has a corresponding LayerView created and rendered in the view.

events.name: arcgisViewLayerviewCreateError
events.description: Fires when an error emits during the creation of a LayerView after a layer has been added to the link chart.

events.name: arcgisViewLayerviewDestroy
events.description: Fires after a LayerView is destroyed and is no longer rendered in the view.

events.name: arcgisViewMouseWheel
events.description: Fires when a wheel button of a pointing device (typically a mouse) is scrolled on the view.

events.name: arcgisViewPointerDown
events.description: Fires after a mouse button is pressed, or a finger touches the display.

events.name: arcgisViewPointerEnter
events.description: Fires after a mouse cursor enters the view, or a display touch begins.

events.name: arcgisViewPointerLeave
events.description: Fires after a mouse cursor leaves the view, or a display touch ends.

events.name: arcgisViewPointerMove
events.description: Fires after the mouse or a finger on the display moves.

events.name: arcgisViewPointerUp
events.description: Fires after a mouse button is released, or a display touch ends.

events.name: arcgisViewReadyChange
events.description:
This event is for the `ready` property and will be emitted when the view is ready.
This event will also emit if the `map` property is changed.

events.name: arcgisViewReadyError
events.description: Fires if the view encounters a content or rendering error.

slots.name: bottom-left
slots.description: Slot for components positioned in the bottom-left corner.

slots.description: Slot for components positioned at the top-start (top-left in LTR, top-right in RTL).

slots.name: bottom-start

slots.name: bottom-end
slots.description: Slot for components positioned at the bottom-end (bottom-right in LTR, bottom-left in RTL).

slots.name: popup
slots.description: Slot for the [Popup](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-popup/) component to open automatically on click. When using this slot, the [`popup-disabled`](#popupDisabled) attribute must be set to `true`. Only the Popup component can be placed in this slot.

declarations.name: ArcgisLinkChartLayoutSwitcher
declarations.description:
A component for use in link charts that allows users to switch between different layouts. See [documentation on layouts](https://enterprise.arcgis.com/en/knowledge/latest/knowledge-studio/change-the-layout-applied-to-a-link-chart.htm) for more details.

Note: Sign in to access the data in this demo, U/P: `viewer01`/`I68VGU^nMurF`

members.name: appearance
members.description: The appearance of the layout switcher. `dropdown` displays a button that is clicked to reveal a dropdown menu, while `menu-bar` displays a menu bar.

members.name: autoDestroyDisabled
members.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-link-chart-layout-switcher/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

members.name: closeOnSelectDisabled
members.description: When `true`, the layout menu will not close when a layout is selected. Only applicable when `appearance` is `dropdown`.

members.name: componentOnReady
members.description: Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.

docsTags.name: example

members.name: destroy
members.description: Permanently destroy the component.

members.name: icon

declarations.name: ArcgisLocate
declarations.description:
The Locate component animates the Map or Scene to the user's current location.

This component uses the browser's [Geolocation API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Geolocation_API) which is only available in [secure contexts](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Secure_Contexts), such as HTTPS.
Note that localhost is considered "potentially secure" and can be used for easy testing in browsers that support
[Window.isSecureContext](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/isSecureContext#browser_compatibility).

declarations.name: ArcgisMap
declarations.description:
The ArcGIS Map component is used to add 2D maps to web applications. For 3D maps, use the
[ArcGIS Scene component](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/).

The Map component creates a [MapView](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html) and loads a WebMap from either [ArcGIS Online](https://www.arcgis.com/home/index.html) or [ArcGIS Enterprise portal](https://enterprise.arcgis.com/en/portal/latest/administer/windows/what-is-portal-for-arcgis-.htm).

```html
<arcgis-map item-id="05e015c5f0314db9a487a9b46cb37eca"></arcgis-map>
```

Alternatively, the Map component can be initialized without a WebMap item.

```html
<arcgis-map basemap="satellite" center="-154.88, 19.46" zoom="15"></arcgis-map>
```

Other components can be added and connected to the Map component.

```html
<arcgis-map item-id="05e015c5f0314db9a487a9b46cb37eca">
 <arcgis-zoom slot="top-left"></arcgis-zoom>
 <arcgis-legend slot="bottom-left"></arcgis-legend>
</arcgis-map>
```

The Map component can be customized further using any of the [core API functionalities](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/) of the ArcGIS Maps SDK for JavaScript.

```js
const viewElement = document.querySelector("arcgis-map");
viewElement.addEventListener("arcgisViewReadyChange", () => {
 const layer = new GraphicsLayer({ title: "My Layer" });
 viewElement.map.add(layer);
});
```

See also:
- [SDK sample apps using the Map component](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/?tagged=arcgis-map)
- [Get started](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/get-started/)
- [Programming patterns](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/programming-patterns/)

members.name: allLayerViews
members.description:
Collection containing a flat list of all the created LayerViews
related to the basemap, operational layers, and group layers in this view.

members.name: analyses
members.description:
A collection of analyses associated with the view.

[Read more...](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-View2D.html#analyses)

members.name: animationsDisabled
members.description:
Indicates whether animations are disabled in the view. This includes animated symbols (animated
[CIMSymbol](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-CIMSymbol.html),
[PictureMarkerSymbol](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-PictureMarkerSymbol.html)
from a GIF/animated PNG), animated renderers
([FlowRenderer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-rasterRenderers.html#FlowRenderer)),
animated layers ([MediaLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-MediaLayer.html),
[VideoLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-VideoLayer.html)), and
animations triggered by view navigation (for example,
[goTo()](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#goTo)).
Setting this property to `true` disables all animations in the view.

members.name: aria
members.description: The ARIA attributes for the view container. Provides accessibility information to assistive technologies such as screen readers. Supports the following properties: [`label`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Reference/Attributes/aria-label), [`description`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Reference/Attributes/aria-description), [`describedByElements`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/ariaDescribedByElements), and [`labelledByElements`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/ariaLabelledByElements).

members.name: autoDestroyDisabled
members.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-map/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

members.name: background
members.description: The background color of the Map component.

members.name: basemap
members.description:
Specifies a basemap for the map. The basemap is a set of layers that give
geographic context to the view and the other operational layers
in the map.
It can either be set using a basemap ID string ([see values](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html#basemap)),
[Basemap](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Basemap.html)
or [BasemapStyle](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-support-BasemapStyle.html).

[Read more](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html#basemap)

members.name: basemapView
members.description: Represents the view for a single basemap after it has been added to the map.

members.name: center
members.description:
Represents the view's center point; when setting the center, you may pass a
[Point](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-geometry-Point.html) instance or a string representing
a longitude/latitude pair (`"-100.4593, 36.9014"`).
Setting the center immediately changes the current view.
For animating the view, see this component's [goTo()](#goTo) method.

members.name: closePopup
members.description: Closes the popup.

members.name: componentOnReady
members.description: Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.

docsTags.name: example

members.name: constraints
members.description: Specifies constraints to scale, zoom, and rotation that may be applied to the map.

members.name: destroy
members.description: Destroys the view, and any associated resources, including its map, popup, and UI elements.

members.name: displayFilterDisabled
members.description:
Indicates whether a layer's `displayFilter` is honored when rendering layers in the view.
If `false`, display filters are ignored and all features are rendered.

members.name: extent
members.description:
The extent represents the visible portion of a map within the view as an instance of [Extent](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-geometry-Extent.html).
Setting the extent immediately changes the view without animation. To animate
the view, see this component's [goTo()](#goTo) method.
When the view is rotated, the extent does not update to include the newly visible portions of the map.

members.name: fatalError
members.description: A rejected view indicates a fatal error making it unable to display.

members.name: floors
members.description:
Applies a display filter on the view for a specific set of floor levels.
It can filter the map display on floor-aware layers by zero or more level IDs.

members.name: gamepad
members.description: Gamepad input specific configuration settings.

members.name: goTo
members.description: Sets the view to a given target.

members.name: graphics
members.description: Allows for adding graphics directly to the default graphics in the View.

docsTags.name: example
example

members.name: ground
members.description: Specifies the surface properties for the map.

members.name: highlightOptions
members.description: Options for configuring the highlight.
members.deprecated: since version 4.32. Use the [highlights](#highlights) property instead.

members.name: highlights
members.description:
The highlights property is a collection of [HighlightOptions](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-support-HighlightOptions.html) objects that
allow you to visually emphasize specific features on the map. See [MapView.highlights](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#highlights) for more information.

members.name: hitTest
members.description: Returns hit test results from each layer that intersects the specified screen coordinates.

members.name: interacting
members.description: Indicates whether the view is being interacted with (for example, when panning or via an interactive tool).

members.name: ipsInfo
members.description: Contains indoor positioning system information for the map.

members.name: itemId
members.description:
The ID of a WebMap from ArcGIS Online or ArcGIS Enterprise portal.

To configure the portal url you must set the [`portalUrl` property on `config`](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-config.html#portalUrl) before the Map component loads.

members.name: layerViews
members.description:
A collection containing a hierarchical list of all the created
[LayerView](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-layers-LayerView.html)s of the
[operational layers](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html#layers) in the map.

members.name: loadErrorSources
members.description: An array of objects that encountered an error while loading the component or any of its dependencies (e.g., basemap, ground, layers, tables). You may inspect the errors by accessing each object's `loadError` property.

type.text: Array<WebLinkChart | Basemap | Ground | Layer | WebMap | WebScene>

members.name: magnifier
members.description: The magnifier allows for showing a portion of the view as a magnifier image on top of the view.

members.name: map
members.description: An instance of a [Map](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html) object to display in the view.

members.name: navigating
members.description: Indication whether the view is being navigated (for example when panning).

members.name: navigation
members.description: Options to configure the navigation behavior of the View.

members.name: openPopup
members.description:
Opens the popup at the given location with content defined either explicitly with content or driven
from the PopupTemplate of input features.

members.name: padding
members.description:
Padding to make the map's center and extent work off a
subsection of the full map. This is particularly useful when layering UI
elements or semi-transparent content on top of portions of the map.

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [Sample: Map padding](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/map-padding/)

members.name: popup
members.description:
A [Popup](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-widgets-Popup.html) object that displays general content or attributes from
[layers](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html#layers) in the [map](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-View2D.html#map).

[Read more...](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-View2D.html#popup)

members.name: popupDisabled
members.description: Controls whether the popup opens automatically when users click on the view.

members.name: ready
members.description:
When `true`, this property indicates whether the [view](#view) has successfully satisfied all dependencies, signaling that the following conditions are met:

* The view has a [map](#map). If [map](#map)
is a [WebMap](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-WebMap.html), then the map
must be [loaded](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-WebMap.html#loaded).
* The view has a [spatialReference](#spatialReference), a [center](#center), and a [scale](#scale).
These also can be inferred by setting an [extent](#extent).

When a view becomes ready it will resolve itself and invoke
the callback defined in [viewOnReady()](#viewOnReady) where code can execute on a working view.

members.name: resizeAlign
members.description:
Defines which anchor stays still while resizing the browser window. The default, `center`,
ensures the view's center point remains constantly visible as the window size changes. The other
options allow  the respective portion of the view to remain visible when the window's size is changed.

members.name: resolution
members.description:
Represents the current value of one pixel in the unit of the view's spatialReference.
The value of resolution is calculated by dividing the view's extent width
by its width.

members.name: rotation
members.description:
The clockwise rotation of due north in relation to the top of the view in degrees.
The view may be rotated by directly setting
the rotation or by using the following mouse event: `Right-click + Drag`.
Map rotation may be disabled by setting the `rotationEnabled` property
in [constraints](#constraints) to `false`. See the code snippet below for
an example of this.

members.name: scale
members.description:
Represents the map scale at the center of the view. Setting the scale immediately changes the view. For animating
the view, see this component's [goTo()](#goTo) method.

members.name: spatialReference
members.description:
The spatial reference of the view.
This indicates the projected or geographic coordinate system used
to locate geographic features in the map.

members.name: spatialReferenceLocked
members.description:
Indicates if the map's [spatialReference](#spatialReference) can be changed after it is ready.
The default is `false`, indicating the map's spatialReference can be changed at runtime.
When true, basemaps with spatial references that do not match the map's spatial reference
will be disabled in [arcgis-basemap-gallery](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-basemap-gallery/) and [arcgis-basemap-toggle](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-basemap-toggle/) components and the map's spatialReference cannot be changed at runtime.

members.name: stationary
members.description: Indication whether the view is animating, being navigated with or resizing.

members.name: suspended
members.description: Indicates if the view is visible on the page.

members.name: takeScreenshot
members.description: Create a screenshot of the current view.

members.name: theme
members.description: This property specifies the base colors used by some components to render graphics and labels.

members.name: timeExtent
members.description:
The view's time extent. Time-aware layers display their temporal data that falls within
the view's time extent. Setting the view's time extent is similar to setting the spatial
extent because once the time extent is set, the
view updates automatically to conform to the change.

members.name: timeZone
members.description:
Defines the time zone of the view.
The time zone property determines how dates and times are represented to the user,
but the underlying data is unchanged.

members.name: tryFatalErrorRecovery
members.description: Call this method to clear any fatal errors resulting from a lost WebGL context.

members.name: updating
members.description:
Indicates whether the view is being updated by additional data requests to the network,
or by processing received data.

members.name: view
members.description: The [MapView](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html) instance created and managed by the component. Accessible once the component is fully loaded.

members.name: viewOnReady
members.description:
`viewOnReady()` may be leveraged once an instance of the component and its underlying [view](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-map/#view) is created and ready.
This method takes two input parameters, a `callback` function and an `errback` function, and returns a promise. The `callback` executes when the promise resolves, and the `errback` executes if the promise is rejected.

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [Watch for changes - waiting for components or views to be ready](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/watch-for-changes/#waiting-for-components-or-views-to-be-ready)

docsTags.name: example

members.name: viewpoint
members.description:
Represents the current view as a Viewpoint or point of observation on the view.
Setting the viewpoint immediately changes the current view. For animating
the view, see this component's [goTo()](#goTo) method.

members.name: visibleArea
members.description:
The visibleArea represents the visible portion of a [map](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html) within the view as
an instance of a [Polygon](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-geometry-Polygon.html).

[Read more...](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-View2D.html#visibleArea)

members.name: whenAnalysisView
members.description:
Gets the analysis view created for the given analysis object.

[Read more](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#whenAnalysisView)

members.name: whenLayerView
members.description:
Gets the LayerView created on the view for the given layer.

[Read more](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#whenLayerView)

members.name: zoom
members.description:
Represents the level of detail (LOD) at the center of the map.
A zoom level (or scale) is a number that defines how large or small the contents of a map appear in a Map component.
Zoom level is a number usually between 0 (global view) and 23 (very detailed view) and is used as a shorthand for predetermined scale values.
A value of -1 means the map has no LODs.
When setting the zoom value, the component converts it to the corresponding scale, or interpolates it if the zoom is a fractional number.

Setting the zoom immediately changes the current view. For animating the view, see this component's [goTo()](#goTo) method.
Setting this property in conjunction with `center` is a convenient way to set the initial extent of the view.

attributes.name: animations-disabled
attributes.description:
Indicates whether animations are disabled in the view. This includes animated symbols (animated
[CIMSymbol](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-CIMSymbol.html),
[PictureMarkerSymbol](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-PictureMarkerSymbol.html)
from a GIF/animated PNG), animated renderers
([FlowRenderer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-rasterRenderers.html#FlowRenderer)),
animated layers ([MediaLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-MediaLayer.html),
[VideoLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-VideoLayer.html)), and
animations triggered by view navigation (for example,
[goTo()](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#goTo)).
Setting this property to `true` disables all animations in the view.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-map/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

attributes.name: basemap
attributes.description:
Specifies a basemap for the map. The basemap is a set of layers that give
geographic context to the view and the other operational layers
in the map.
It can either be set using a basemap ID string ([see values](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html#basemap)),
[Basemap](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Basemap.html)
or [BasemapStyle](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-support-BasemapStyle.html).

[Read more](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html#basemap)

attributes.name: center
attributes.description:
Represents the view's center point; when setting the center, you may pass a
[Point](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-geometry-Point.html) instance or a string representing
a longitude/latitude pair (`"-100.4593, 36.9014"`).
Setting the center immediately changes the current view.
For animating the view, see this component's [goTo()](#goTo) method.

attributes.name: display-filter-disabled
attributes.description:
Indicates whether a layer's `displayFilter` is honored when rendering layers in the view.
If `false`, display filters are ignored and all features are rendered.

attributes.name: ground
attributes.description: Specifies the surface properties for the map.

attributes.name: item-id
attributes.description:
The ID of a WebMap from ArcGIS Online or ArcGIS Enterprise portal.

To configure the portal url you must set the [`portalUrl` property on `config`](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-config.html#portalUrl) before the Map component loads.

attributes.name: popup-disabled
attributes.description: Controls whether the popup opens automatically when users click on the view.

attributes.name: resize-align
attributes.description:
Defines which anchor stays still while resizing the browser window. The default, `center`,
ensures the view's center point remains constantly visible as the window size changes. The other
options allow  the respective portion of the view to remain visible when the window's size is changed.

attributes.name: rotation
attributes.description:
The clockwise rotation of due north in relation to the top of the view in degrees.
The view may be rotated by directly setting
the rotation or by using the following mouse event: `Right-click + Drag`.
Map rotation may be disabled by setting the `rotationEnabled` property
in [constraints](#constraints) to `false`. See the code snippet below for
an example of this.

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description:
Represents the map scale at the center of the view. Setting the scale immediately changes the view. For animating
the view, see this component's [goTo()](#goTo) method.

attributes.name: spatial-reference-locked
attributes.description:
Indicates if the map's [spatialReference](#spatialReference) can be changed after it is ready.
The default is `false`, indicating the map's spatialReference can be changed at runtime.
When true, basemaps with spatial references that do not match the map's spatial reference
will be disabled in [arcgis-basemap-gallery](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-basemap-gallery/) and [arcgis-basemap-toggle](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-basemap-toggle/) components and the map's spatialReference cannot be changed at runtime.

attributes.name: suspended
attributes.description: Indicates if the view is visible on the page.

attributes.name: time-zone
attributes.description:
Defines the time zone of the view.
The time zone property determines how dates and times are represented to the user,
but the underlying data is unchanged.

attributes.name: zoom
attributes.description:
Represents the level of detail (LOD) at the center of the map.
A zoom level (or scale) is a number that defines how large or small the contents of a map appear in a Map component.
Zoom level is a number usually between 0 (global view) and 23 (very detailed view) and is used as a shorthand for predetermined scale values.
A value of -1 means the map has no LODs.
When setting the zoom value, the component converts it to the corresponding scale, or interpolates it if the zoom is a fractional number.

Setting the zoom immediately changes the current view. For animating the view, see this component's [goTo()](#goTo) method.
Setting this property in conjunction with `center` is a convenient way to set the initial extent of the view.

events.name: arcgisLoadError
events.description: Fires when a ArcgisMap fails to load or if one of its dependencies fails to load (e.g., basemap, ground, layers).
